message:
Windows alternative to recordit
مُحَمَّد أبو آدم
https://github.com/kashwaa/Capture
 I didn't have enough time to test it properly,please feel free to branch and modify
name: kashwaa/Capture
caption: github.com
description: Contribute to Capture development by creating an account on GitHub.

data.message: It's a good practive to put temporary files (e.g. .suo, obj) in your .gitignore file
Cool, can you give us a bit of background on the project? How it's different, what technology did you use?

Mohammad Tayseer, yup, you are right, should have remembered to remove them :) 
Amr Eldib the project simply captures any given area on the screen and  outputs it an animated gif file, unlike recordit and gyazo, the file is stored locally instead of uploading the file and outputting the link,
written with c#, .net framework V3.5, I assume it could be ported to Linux using mono, should give it a try later

It's great to have something like that for Windows. Don't worry about porting it to Linux.
Maybe worry about making it easier for users to use right away. Did you consider making an installer. Or making the EXE available for download (if it's only one EXE file)?
^I'd definitely do that after proper testing, I wanted to make the code available first so that I get rather professional feed back first
Mohammad Tayseer I didn't realize that github provides .gitignore templates for most of the known technologies, such great feature
Very important is to provide a README.md
